title:
I recently moved to a new place.
It's situated along a river that leads to the North Sea.
Now I'm waiting for the Vikings.
Dame Alice Street Bright
info: In 2025 I took a photo of Dame Alice Street in Bedford. Then I reduced it to its colours, taking away all its shapes and forms.

title: Dame Alice Street Sections
info: In 2025 I took a photo of Dame Alice Street in Bedford. Then I cut it into rectangles and ordered them. The details taken out of context attract attention.

title:
I grew up within a caste system in Central Europe.
The people of the lowest caste drank beer, used foul language, and drove Fiat 500s.
We convinced ourselves every day that we belonged to the caste just above them.

title:
I still have the one-way ticket from Vienna to London Heathrow.
It was a beautiful flight.
Later, I discovered that all my ghosts had boarded the plane too.

title:
There are more living dinosaurs on Earth today than at any other time in history.
We call them birds.

title:
I remember a bus ride in Britain where one person wanted to close a window because it was cold, while another wanted to open it because it was stuffy.
After a while, they started a physical fight, and we all forgot to get off at our stop.

title: I keep forgetting what I look like, but I have no problem with it because other people remember me vividly.

title:
Sometimes I open the door just to check if the world outside my house still exists.
And I have no idea what I will do if it doesn’t.

title:
I have only one direction: I go to a place where I haven't been before.
And then I go home and rewire my brain.

title:
Early this morning the word "Hauptstraßenfeger" popped into my head. It means "main street sweeper" in German.
The opposite of that would be "Seitenstraßenfeger" - "side street sweeper".
As Spencer Brown said: Draw a distinction.

title:
In the 9th century, a Pope decreed that every church in Europe should display a rooster on its dome or spire.
The rooster is mounted on a spindle with bearings. The tail is larger than the head. When the wind blows, it causes the vane to rotate until the head points into the wind.
Here it points mostly southwest.

I only cannnot pay attention to them.

title:
As a teenager, I heard the line "Sitting on a park bench" in a song featuring a British flutist.
It sounded very dramatic.

title:
There is almost nothing left of the Castle of Bedford.
It was destroyed in 1224 to prevent its use as a fortress against the Crown.
In 2224, a new one will be built.

And you don't.

title:
"Young people are rude and impatient. They no longer rise when their elders enter the room. They contradict their parents and chatter too much. They tyranize their teachers."
(Ancient Sumer, about 3000 BCE)

title:
In 1752, John Howard was imprisoned in Brest and later released again.
In 1777 he published a book about The State of the Prisons in England and Wales, a landmark work that exposed brutal conditions and spurred lasting change.
Today, a statue of him stands on Bedford’s High Street.
HM Prison Bedford visiting times are on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday, and Sunday from 2:00 PM to 3:45 PM.

info: In 2025 I took a photo of a house in Bedford. Then I cut it into rectangles and ordered them. The details taken out of context attract attention.

title:
When I was a child, my mother became best friends with one of our neighbours. One day I asked this neighbour where babies come from. She said she didn’t know - though she had three children herself - and that I should ask my mother.
But I never did. What if she didn’t know either?

title:

Visit the shop on the ground floor and put my art on your walls.
